sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）に大日本帝国が大韓帝国の運営していた通信業務を日本側に委託させたものである。
sen.e: In 1905, the Empire of Japan made the Korean Empire to transfer the control over its communication services to Japan.
In 1905, the Empire of Japan made the Korean Empire to transfer the control of communication services, which had been operated by Korean Empire, to Japan.
In 1905, the Empire of Japan made the Korean Empire to transfer the control of communication services, which had been operated by Korean Empire, to Japan.

sen.j: 朝鮮において1884年11月18日に郵便事業が発足し、事業を担う中央官庁である郵征総局（ko우정총국）がソウルに置かれた。
sen.e: On November 18, 1884, a postal service started in Korea by the launch of the Postal Administration Office (우정총국) in Soule, a central bureaucracy, which operated the business.
On November 18, 1884, the postal service started in Korea by the launch of the General Office for Postal Administration (ko:우정총국) in Seoul, a central bureaucracy, which operated the business.
sen.cmt: Seoulのスペルミスです。「郵征総局」を「General Office for Postal Administration」としました。韓国語表記が・・・・となってしまいます。（選択すると表示されます）
sen.e: On November 18, 1884, the postal service started in Korea by the launch of the General Office for Postal Administration (ko:우정총국) in Seoul, a central bureaucracy, which operated the business.

sen.j: 郵便切手は日本の国立印刷局（大阪の民間印刷会社とする書籍もある）に発注され開業することになった。
sen.e: The printing of postal stamps were ordered to the National Printing Bureau of Japan (or a private printing firm in Osaka according to some books) and services started.

sen.j: 郵便創業の立役者であったのは「紳士遊覧団」として日本に留学経験のあった弱冠30歳の洪英植であった。
sen.e: The architect of formation of postal service was Hong Young Shik, then only 30 years old, who had studied in Japan as the member of The Gentlemen Observation Mission (the Korean Courtiers' Observation Mission) to Japan.
Hong Young Shik, who had studied in Japan as a member of the Courtiers' Observation Mission and only 30 years old at that time, was the central figure in establishment of postal service.
sen.cmt: 「紳士遊覧団」は、the Courtier's Observation Missionのみ残し、後を削除しました。書き換えました。
sen.e: Hong Young Shik, who had studied in Japan as a member of the Courtiers' Observation Mission and only 30 years old at that time, was the central figure in establishment of postal service.

sen.j: しかし清国の内政干渉を嫌う洪英植、金玉均、朴泳孝らの開化派が朝鮮の立憲君主国家への転換を狙い引き起こしたクーデタ、いわゆる甲申政変は、12月4日にの郵征総局開庁祝賀式典に乗じて事を始めた。
sen.e: Taking the occasion of the opening ceremony of the Postal Administration Office on December 4, the enlightenment group led by Hong Young Shik, Kim Ok-gyun and Pak Yonghyo who resented Qing's interference in Korean affairs staged a coup d'etat, so-called Gapsin Coup for the purpose of transforming Korea into a constitutional monarchy.

An enlightenment group led by Hong Young Shik, Kim Ok-gyun and Pak Yonghyo, who opposed to Qing's interference in the Korean internal affairs, seized occasion of a ceremony making the start of operations at the General Office for Postal Administration to stage a coup, what is called Gapsin Coup, for the purpose of transforming Korea into a constitutional monarchy.

In what became known as the Gapsin Coup, an enlightenment group led by Hong Young Shik, Kim Ok-gyun and Pak Yonghyo, who opposed any Qing interference in Korea's internal affairs, seized the occasion of a ceremony marking the start of operations at the General Office for Postal Administration to stage a coup on December 4; their coup was intended to transform Korea into a constitutional monarchy.
sen.cmt: 「12月4日に」の訳漏れに対応しました。

sen.j: このクーデタは袁世凱が指揮する清国の軍隊による武力介入で失敗に終わった。
sen.e: This coup ended in a failure due to the military intervention commanded by YUAN Shikai, and the Postal Administration Office was burnt down and the leader Hong Young Shik was executed for being a part of it.
This coup ended in a failure due to a military intervention of Qing's army led by YUAN Shikai.

sen.j: 郵征総局も焼き討ちにあい、責任者であった洪英植もクーデタに加担していたことから処刑された。
sen.e: The Postal Administration Office was burnt down and Hong Young Shik, who was the responsible person of postal service, was executed for being a part of it.

sen.j: そのため開業した郵便事業は短期間で閉鎖に追い込まれた。
sen.e: Consequently, the postal services were forced to close shortly after its opening.

sen.j: 発行された切手2種は無効になり、印刷されながら発行できなかった他の額面の切手とともに格安で払下げられた。
sen.e: The two stamps issued were invalidated and disposed of by the government for a song together with the stamps of other face values which had been printed but were not issued.
Two stamps issued were invalidated and were sold at a very low price together with stamps of other face value, which were printed but not issued.

sen.j: この時朝鮮で実際に扱われた郵便物は僅かであった。
sen.e: In fact, only a small amount of mails were handled in Korea at the time.

sen.e: Nowadays, Hong Young Shik is respected by Korean people as the father of modern Korean postal service.
Nowadays, Hong Young Shik is respected by Korean people as the father of modern Korean postal service.

sen.j: 1895年7月になって、朝鮮の郵便事業は再開された。
sen.e: Korean postal service was resumed in July 1895.
Korean postal service was resumed in July 1895.

sen.j: しかし短期間で郵便事業は行き詰まり、1898年にはフランス人クレマンセーが通信事業の顧問として招聘された。
sen.e: But the postal service was soon stuck in a financial trouble and クレマンセー, French, was invited as the advisor in 1898.

sen.j: これは、この時期フランスは日本に対する三国干渉で極東地域への影響力を伸ばそうとしていた。

This was because France was trying to expand its influence over the Far East at the time, by the Triple Intervention against Japan.

sen.e: This way, France had its share in modernizing Korea.
Therefore, France had also interfered in modernization of Korea.
Therefore, France had also interfered in modernization of Korea.

sen.j: 1900年には韓国政府は通信院を設置し万国郵便連合（UPU）にも加盟し、国際的郵便網に入った。

sen.e: It was expected to facilitate the exchange of posts between Japan and Korea and Japanese post offices gradually spread all over Korea.
It was originally aimed to facilitate the exchange of posts between Japan and Korea, but later more post offices were established in various regions of Korea by Japan.
It was originally aimed to facilitate the exchange of posts between Japan and Korea, but later more post offices were established in various regions of Korea by Japan.

The stamps sold in Japan Post Office in Korea on January 1, 1900 were overprinted with "朝鮮" (Korea in Chinese character), but were canceled at the end of March 1901.

sen.j: 1904年2月23日に「局外中立宣言」をしていた韓国との間で日韓議定書を締結し、日本が必要であれば朝鮮半島各地で軍隊を展開できるようになり、通行権などが確保された。
sen.e: On February 23, 1904, although Korea had announced the 'Neutrality declaration', Japan concluded the Japan-Korea Protocol with Korea, which allowed Japan to develop its army in various places of Korean Peninsula when necessary and ensured the right-of-way and etc.

sen.e: Furthermore, the First Japan-Korea Agreement was concluded in August which brought the Korean government to receive Japanese financial and diplomatic advisors as well as to sit at the negotiating table for the conclusion of a treaty.
